wikipedia_page.main: Stephen Stuart Solomon Conway (born February 1948) is a British property developer, the founder, chairman and CEO of Galliard Homes, London's largest privately owned residential property developer.

response: Steve, Steven or Stephen Conway may refer to:
* Stephen Conway (property developer) (born 1948), British property developer
* Stephen Conway (cricketer) (born 1974), English academic and cricketer

Galliard Homes was founded in 1992, by Stephen Conway, who is still its chairman and stepped down as CEO in 2017. In 1993, Galliard Homes purchased the completed Papermill Wharf. Galliard's Victorian conversion, Burrells Wharf followed in 1994, including a statue of engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel. Further developments in the Docklands include Great Jubilee Wharf and Millennium Quay.
Led by chairman and chief executive officer Stephen Conway, the Group has three divisions, Galliard Homes, Galliard Commercial and Galliard Construction.
